page.title: 07EAST MERSEA OYSTER FISHERY
page.content: The oyster fishery is run as a joint venture with one in Scotland.The oysters are bred there and then cleaned,purified and salted in East Mersea.Two different types of oyster, the Native and Pacific are cultivated. Some 90 tonnes or about 10800 oysters are sold annually. All of the oysters are sold alive. The most important market is London.Other shellfish are kept in tanks as the market is growing At present twenty people are employed,most live in Brightlingsea and come to work by boat.The owners would like to build a restaurant and car park on the site of the fishery but the development is controversial. When planning permission was originally granted it was agreed there would be no further commercialisation in this area of Special Scientific Interest.
